title: Shocking moment disabled pensioner on mobility scooter robbed in street as motorists drive past without stopping
text:
Shocking moment disabled pensioner on mobility scooter robbed in street as motorists drive past without stopping The 74-year-old victim's necklance was snatched as he tried to get away from thieves   Share   Comments By Sam Yarwood 22:54, 20 FEB 2017 News Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch Next Baroness Crawley references Game of Thrones Watch this video again Watch Next Anti-Trump protest marches on Downing Street 0:34 One of the gruesome scenes from Anatomy Lab Live 0:24 Attack on cafes in Istanbul 1:02 Pensioners fight off screwdriver-wielding thug 0:33 Tory MP Sir Edward Leigh seems to defend Trump 1:13 Radio 4 presenter Steve Hewlett talks about his h 0:51 Aircraft 'crashes into shops' next to Melbourne's 0:23 Arsene Wenger speaks after Arsenal beat Sutton Un 1:39 Drunken 'animal lover' savagely attacked his dog 1:23 BBC pundits Lavish praise on Arsenal's Lucas Perez 0:42 Video will play in  Man on mobility scooter robbed as cars just drive by Share this video Watch Next   Share   Comments Get daily   This is the shocking moment a disabled pensioner on a mobility scooter is robbed in the middle of the street as motorists drive on by.
The 74-year-old’s necklace was snatched as he tried to get away from the thieves on Sunday morning.
Police say he had been driving along a road in Ashton-under-Lyne, Greater Manchester, at around 9.15am when a man ran up behind him.
The suspect got out a map of the London Underground and started asking him for directions, before a woman in what appears to be a long purple dress confronted the victim from the other side.
The robbers follow the pensioner (Photo: MEN WS) The robbers surround the pensioner and rob him (Photo: MEN WS) As the pensioner tried to drive off, the woman stuck her hand out and snatched the necklace, and the pair fled, the Manchester Evening News reports. 
Footage of the incident shows the victim in the middle of the street struggling with the robbers, while at least two vehicles pass on by – even mounting the kerb to get past.
A spokesman for GMP confirmed they were investigating the incident, and were aware of the CCTV.
GMP said: “We were called at 9.28am on February 19 to reports of a robbery.
“A man had been driving down Keswick Avenue in Ashton-under-Lyne on a mobility scooter when he was approached from behind by two people and his necklace stolen.
“The male suspect is described as being white, in his early thirties, around 5ft 8ins tall and of skinny build. He was wearing a grey woolly hat with a brown jacket and blue jeans.
“The woman was around 40-years-old, 5ft 8ins tall, of large build with shoulder length brown hair.
“Anyone with information is asked to contact police on 101 using the log number 733 of February 19.”
